intro: Lithospermum ciliolatum, commonly known as the hairy rock pepper, is a herbaceous perennial native to the western United States. It features slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs, and its leaves are lance-shaped with a distinctive hairy texture. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from pale pink to deep red, typically blooming in late summer. Its roots contain compounds that have been studied for potential medicinal properties. Lithospermum ciliolatum thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments.
